content.raw:
Yes, weak pointer parent references sound like the way to go and would definitely solve this case!

I think you're right that there's stuff like this going on in Gazebo; the project I'm currently working on does a lot of model deletes (I'm evolving robots so the oldest "die", see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9wny4iarR9w if you're bored...) and I''m still seeing significant memory leaks / slowdowns in relation to that. I'm trying to figure out what's causing them so expect more issues from me in the Gazebo repo in the coming weeks ;).
